CWEs: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function does not validate the input data, which can lead to potential SQL Injection or Cross-site Scripting attacks. The function directly uses the input data to perform operations without checking its validity. An attacker can send malicious data and perform unwanted operations. The function should validate and sanitize the input data before using it.
